pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī—“bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappetun”ti tassāyeva kumārikāya saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesi kālayuttaṃ samullapanto kālayuttaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.2.eng: At this time Venerable Udāyī heard that the Buddha had prohibited sitting alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for the deed, and so instead he sat down in private alone with the same girl. When they were able, they just chatted; otherwise he gave her a teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.3.pli: Dutiyampi kho visākhā migāramātā nimantitā taṃ kulaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.3.eng: A second time Visākhā had been invited to that family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.4.pli: Addasā kho visākhā migāramātā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ tassāyeva kumārikāya saddhiṃ ekaṃ ekāya raho nisinnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.4.eng: When she arrived, she saw Udāyī sitting in private alone with the same girl,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.6.pli: “idaṃ, bhante, nacchannaṃ nappatirūpaṃ yaṃ ayyo mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.6.eng: “Venerable, it’s not appropriate for you to sit down in private alone with a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.7.pli: Kiñcāpi, bhante, ayyo anatthiko tena dhammena, api ca dussaddhāpayā appasannā manussā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.7.eng: You may not be aiming at that act, but it’s hard to convince people with little confidence.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.8.pli: Evampi kho āyasmā udāyī visākhāya migāramātuyā vuccamāno nādiyi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.9.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā nikkhamitvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.9.eng: After leaving, Visākhā told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.11.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī sit down in private alone with a woman?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.12.eng: After rebuking Udāyī in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.13.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.16.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.19.1.pli: “Na heva kho pana paṭicchannaṃ āsanaṃ hoti nālaṅkammaniyaṃ, alañca kho hoti mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.19.1.eng: ‘Although a seat is not concealed, nor suitable for the deed, it may be suitable for speaking indecently to a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.20.pli: Yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpe āsane mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeyya, tamenaṃ saddheyyavacasā upāsikā disvā
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.20.eng: If a monk sits down on such a seat in private alone with a woman, and a trustworthy female lay follower sees him

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.21.pli: dvinnaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya—saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.21.eng: and accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.22.pli: Nisajjaṃ bhikkhu paṭijānamāno dvinnaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena kāretabbo— saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.22.eng: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these two

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.23.pli: Yena vā sā saddheyyavacasā upāsikā vadeyya tena so bhikkhu kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.23.eng: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.1.pli: Na heva kho pana paṭicchannaṃ āsanaṃ hotīti
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.1.eng: Although a seat is not concealed:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.2.pli: appaṭicchannaṃ hoti kuṭṭena vā kavāṭena vā kilañjena vā sāṇipākārena vā rukkhena vā thambhena vā kotthaḷiyā vā yena kenaci appaṭicchannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.2.eng: it is not concealed by a wall, a screen, a door, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.4.pli: na sakkā hoti methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.4.eng: one is not able to have sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.5.pli: Alañca kho hoti mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsitunti
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.5.eng: It may be suitable for speaking indecently to a woman:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.6.pli: sakkā hoti mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.6.eng: one is able to speak indecently to a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.10.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.14.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī na petī na tiracchānagatā, viññū paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.14.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.18.eng: just the monk and the woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.20.eng: private to the eye and private to the ear.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.22.pli: na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.22.eng: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.24.eng: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.26.pli: mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.26.eng: the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.27.pli: Bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.27.eng: The woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.28.pli: Ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.28.eng: Both are seated or both are lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.30.eng: she has attained the fruit, she has broken through, she has understood the instruction.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.32.pli: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.32.eng: she has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.1.pli: Dvinnaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.1.eng: If she accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.2.pli: Nisajjaṃ bhikkhu paṭijānamāno dvinnaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena kāretabbo— saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.2.eng: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these two

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.3.pli: Yena vā sā saddheyyavacasā upāsikā vadeyya, tena so bhikkhu kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.3.eng: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.4.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.5.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.5.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.6.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.6.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.7.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.8.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.8.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.10.pli: “saccāhaṃ nisinno, no ca kho kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.10.eng: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t make physical contact,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.11.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.13.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.15.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.16.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.17.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nipanno mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.17.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down, making physical contact with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.18.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.18.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.19.pli: “saccāhaṃ nipanno, no ca kho kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.19.eng: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t make physical contact,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.20.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.22.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.24.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.25.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.26.pli: “ayyassa mayā sutaṃ nisinnassa mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsantassā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.26.eng: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while seated,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.27.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.27.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.28.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.29.pli: “ayyassa mayā sutaṃ nisinnassa mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsantassā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.29.eng: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while seated,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.31.pli: “saccāhaṃ nisinno, no ca kho duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.31.eng: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t speak indecently,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.32.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.34.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.36.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.37.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.38.pli: “ayyassa mayā sutaṃ nipannassa mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsantassā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.38.eng: “I’ve heard you speaking indecently to a woman while lying down,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.39.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.39.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.40.pli: saccāhaṃ nipanno, no ca kho duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsinti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.40.eng: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t speak indecently,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.41.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.43.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.45.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.46.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.47.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisinno”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.47.eng: “I’ve seen you seated in private alone with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.48.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, nisajjāya kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.48.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.50.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.52.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.53.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.54.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nipanno”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.54.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down in private alone with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.55.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, nipajjāya kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.55.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.56.pli: nāhaṃ nipanno, api ca kho nisinnoti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.57.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.58.pli: nāhaṃ nipanno, api ca kho ṭhitoti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.59.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.61.eng: this is said with reference to the previous undetermined rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.63.pli: na niyato, saṅghādiseso vā pācittiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.63.eng: not determined. It is either an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.1.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.1.eng: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.2.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.2.eng: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, yet he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.3.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjāya kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.3.eng: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, but he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.4.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, na kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.4.eng: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.5.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.5.eng: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.6.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.6.eng: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, but he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.7.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjāya kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.7.eng: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, yet he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.8.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, na kāretabboti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.8.eng: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.9.eng: The second undetermined offense is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.10.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho āyasmanto dve aniyatā dhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.10.eng: “Venerables, the two undetermined rules have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.11.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.23.eng: The undetermined offenses have been well laid down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.24.eng: By the Stable One, the Buddha who is the best.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.25.eng: The chapter on undetermined offenses is finished.
